newsitem.title: UK: CRICKET-TAYLOR FIGHTS BACK WITH UNBEATEN TEST CENTURY.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-TAYLOR FIGHTS BACK WITH UNBEATEN TEST CENTURY.

text.p: Australia's captain Mark Taylor ended his form crisis by scoring his first test century since November 1995 to lead an Ashes fightback against England on Saturday.
Taylor battled to an unbeaten 108 as Australia, 360 behind on first innings, made 256 for one in their second innings by the close on the third day of the first test at Edgbaston.
The Australian skipper, whose place was in jeopardy after failing to reach 50 in a test for 18 months, shared century stands with fellow opener Matthew Elliott and Greg Blewett.
Taylor put on 133 with Elliott (66) and then shared an unfinished second wicket partnership of 123 with Blewett (61 not out).
Earlier, England added 29 for the loss of three wickets before declaring at 478 for nine.
